001package Ch21_GeometricOperations;
002
003import ij.IJ;
004import ij.ImagePlus;
005import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
006import ij.gui.PolygonRoi;
007import ij.gui.Roi;
008import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
009import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
010import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
011import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
012import imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.linear.LinearMapping2D;
013import imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.linear.ProjectiveMapping2D;
014import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
015import imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils;
016import imagingbook.common.ij.RoiUtils;
017import imagingbook.common.image.ImageMapper;
018import imagingbook.common.image.interpolation.InterpolationMethod;
019import imagingbook.common.math.PrintPrecision;
020import imagingbook.sampleimages.GeneralSampleImage;
021
022/**
023 * <p>
024 * ImageJ plugin, performs 4-point projective mapping from a selected polygon
025 * ROI to the specified paper proportions (A4 or Letter, in portrait format).
026 * See Sec. 21.1 (Exercise 21.5 and Fig. 21.17) of [1] for more details.
027 * </p>
028 * <p>
029 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
030 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
031 * </p>
032 * 
033 * @author W. Burger
034 * @version 2022/11/28
035 * 
036 * @see ProjectiveMapping2D
037 * @see LinearMapping2D
038 * @see ImageMapper
039 */
040public class Rectify_Quad_Selection implements PlugInFilter {
041        
042        private static PaperFormatType PaperFormat = PaperFormatType.A4;
043        private static double OutputPixelSize = 0.5;    // pixel size in mm
044        private static InterpolationMethod IPM = InterpolationMethod.Bilinear;
045        private static boolean ListTransformationMatrix = true;
046        
047        private ImagePlus im = null;
048        
049        /**
050         * Constructor, asks to create sample image if no other image
051         * is currently open.
052         */
053        public Rectify_Quad_Selection() {
054                if (IjUtils.noCurrentImage() && DialogUtils.askForSampleImage()) {
055                        ImagePlus imp = GeneralSampleImage.PostalPackageSmall_jpg.getImage();
056                        float[] xpts = {22, 330, 981, 756};     // manually selected!
057                        float[] ypts = {347, 71, 207, 591};
058                        Roi roi = new PolygonRoi(xpts, ypts, Roi.POLYGON);
059                        imp.setRoi(roi);
060                        imp.show();
061                }
062        }
063        
064        // -----------------------------------------------
065        
066        @Override
067        public int setup(String arg0, ImagePlus im) {
068                this.im = im;
069                return DOES_ALL + NO_CHANGES + ROI_REQUIRED;
070        }
071
072        @Override
073        public void run(ImageProcessor source) {
074                Roi roi = im.getRoi();
075                if (!(roi instanceof PolygonRoi)) {
076                        IJ.error("Polygon selection required!");
077                        return;
078                }
079                
080                Pnt2d[] sourceCorners = RoiUtils.getOutlinePointsFloat(roi);
081                if (sourceCorners.length < 4) {
082                        IJ.error("At least 4 points must be selected!");
083                        return;
084                }
085                
086                if (!runDialog()) {
087                        return;
088                }
089                
090                double targetWidth = PaperFormat.width;         // in millimeters
091                double targetHeight = PaperFormat.height;
092                                
093                int tWidth  = (int) Math.round(targetWidth  / OutputPixelSize); // pixels
094                int tHeight = (int) Math.round(targetHeight / OutputPixelSize);
095                
096                Pnt2d[] targetCorners = {
097                                PntInt.from(0, 0),
098                                PntInt.from(tWidth, 0),
099                                PntInt.from(tWidth, tHeight),
100                                PntInt.from(0, tHeight)};
101                
102                LinearMapping2D mp = // inverse mapping (target to source)
103                                ProjectiveMapping2D.fromPoints(sourceCorners, targetCorners).getInverse();      
104
105                if (ListTransformationMatrix) {
106                        PrintPrecision.set(6);
107                        IJ.log("Inverse transformation (target to source): M = \n" + mp.toString());
108                }
109        
110                ImageProcessor target = source.createProcessor(tWidth, tHeight);
111                ImageMapper mapper = new ImageMapper(mp, null, IPM);
112                mapper.map(source, target);
113                new ImagePlus("target", target).show();
114        }
115        
116        // --------------------------------------------
117        
118        enum PaperFormatType {
119                A4(210, 297),
120                Letter(216, 279);
121                
122                final double width, height;             // paper dimensions in mm
123                
124                PaperFormatType(double width, double height) {
125                        this.width = width;
126                        this.height = height;
127                }
128        }
129        
130        // --------------------------------------------
131        
132        private boolean runDialog() {
133                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(this.getClass().getSimpleName());
134                gd.addMessage(DialogUtils.makeLineSeparatedString(
135                                "How to use: Select the four corners of the quad to be rectified",
136                                "with a polygon ROI, in clockwise direction, starting at the point",
137                                "that should map to the top-left corner (in portrait mode).",
138                                "Note that only the first 4 points are used!"));
139                
140                gd.addEnumChoice("Output paper format", PaperFormat);
141                gd.addNumericField("Output pixel size (mm)", OutputPixelSize, 2);
142                gd.addEnumChoice("Pixel interpolation method", IPM);
143                gd.addCheckbox("List transformation matrix", ListTransformationMatrix);
144                
145                gd.showDialog();
146                if (gd.wasCanceled())
147                        return false;
148        
149                PaperFormat = gd.getNextEnumChoice(PaperFormatType.class);
150                OutputPixelSize = gd.getNextNumber();
151                IPM = gd.getNextEnumChoice(InterpolationMethod.class);
152                ListTransformationMatrix = gd.getNextBoolean();
153                
154                return true;
155        }
156        
157}
